info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 22 at 10:57PM CDT until March 22 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL TALLADEGA AND SOUTHWESTERN CLAY COUNTIES... At 1057 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sycamore, or 7 miles east of Sylacauga, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Sylacauga, Sycamore, Overbrook, Hollins, Roselle, Millerville, Mignon and Sylacauga Municipal Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for east central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
